conclusion: Analyze the particle's motion from point A to point C via the two semi-circular arcs.
The particle starts at point A, travels along a semi-circular arc from A to B, then along another semi-circular arc from B to C. Each arc has a radius of 1 meter.
The total travel time is 5 seconds.
The displacement is the straight-line distance from A to C, which is 4 meters eastward.
Average velocity = Displacement ÷ Time = 4 m ÷ 5 s = 0.8 m/s in the eastward direction.
The total distance traveled is the sum of the lengths of the two semi-circular arcs, which is 2π m.
Average speed = Total distance ÷ Time = 2π m ÷ 5 s = 2π/5 m/s ≈ 1.26 m/s.
Average velocity is a vector quantity (with both magnitude and direction), while average speed is a scalar quantity (magnitude only).
Final Answer: Average velocity: 0.8 m/s eastward, Average speed: 2π/5 m/s ≈ 1.26 m/s.
